item.title: NHK filming at CVSSP
item.description: During the weekend, the Japanese TV Broadcaster NHK came to film an experiment in face matching, comparing the performance of our face recognition system with that of a super recogniser, an individual with exceptional ability to recognise faces, whose company provides services to the UK police in analysing CCTV videos.

item.title: Smile, you're on camera, and it knows who you are
item.description: Smile, you’re on camera, and it knows who you are BBC, 7 February 2017

item.title: The Surrey Face Model
item.description: This page is concerned with the availability and downloading of the 3D morphable face models created at the Centre of Vision, Speech and Signal Processing at the University of Surrey. The models are available in these resolutions: 29587, 16759, 3448 and 1724 vertices.

item.title: Advancements in Face Research: A Conversation Between Humans and Machines
item.description: The event will cover new and emerging techniques in the area of face research and analysis, providing a means of discussing your research to get feedback from similar fields. This also provides you with an opportunity to brain storm ideas on how to further the current state of the art.

item.title: Extending NMF to 3D Registered Data
item.description: The use of non-negative matrix factorisation (NMF) on 2D face images has been shown to result in sparse feature vectors that encode for local patches on the face, and thus provides a statistically justified approach to learning parts from wholes.

item.title: 3D Morphable Face Model and its Applications
item.description: 3D Morphable Face Models (3DMM) have been used in face recognition for some time now. They can be applied in their own right as a basis for 3D face recognition and analysis involving 3D face data.
